data: ED Buprenorphine-Naloxone (Suboxone) (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Discharge Criteria: when patient is comfortable and/or maximum dose of buprenorphine-naloxone is reached
Status
If patient is not a candidate for immediate initiation in ED (not in sufficient withdrawal), provide take-home buprenorphine-naloxone if available
Take home buprenorphine-naloxone kit is not intended for patients starting therapy in the ED

Buprenorphine-naloxone initiation requires an addiction consult in the following cases:  
-Altered LOC/intoxication   
-Pregnancy  
-Liver dysfunction   
-Respiratory distress  
-On prescribed opioids for pain management  
-On opioid agonist therapy e.g. methadone or sustained release oral morphine
Patient Care
Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale

Pre-initiation monitoring: Complete COWS at first sign of opioid withdrawal. Assess patient q2h until COWS is 9, then q1h until COWS is greater than 12. On initiation monitoring: q30min for 2 doses or times
Medications

For sites without buprenorphine-naloxone take home kit, provide patients receiving home induction with a prescription: buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab, dispense 18 tabs for home induction. Day 1: 2 mg, sublingual, q1h, PRN up to maximum of 6 tabs (12 mg). Day 2: 12 mg sublingual. Day 3: 16 mg, sublingual, qdaily. Dispense all tabs as carries
Provide Buprenorphine-Naloxone take home kit if COWS less than or equal to 12 and not eligible for induction in the ED
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
2 mg, sublingual, once, drug form: kit, Dispense Take Home Medication, Dispense qty: 18 tab
For patient receiving buprenorphine-naloxone in ED:
Notify Treating Provider
Notify provider when COWS score greater than 12
Provider MUST verify COWS is greater than 12 prior to first dose
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
2 mg, sublingual, once, drug form: tab
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
2 mg, sublingual, q1h, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
Non Categorized
Follow up for Discharge Planning: Write discharge prescription for total dose of buprenorphine-naloxone received in ED as once a day x number of days until RAAC or local opioid agonist therapy clinic
